doc.repnme: Privatization in Estonia : major accomplishments and remaining problems
doc.abstracts: Estonia has one of the best overall economic reform and, in particular, privatization records of any part of the former Soviet Union. It has adopted a range of divestiture methods aimed at putting assets into the hands of those with the incentives and skills to use them wisely. What are the factors that have made this success possible? First, good policy. Second, good politics. Third, good history. And fourth, good geography. This Note outlines the various divestiture methods used in the Estonian privatization, reviews the results of these efforts, and discusses the problems remained to be addressed. Other post-communist countries would do well to examine the Estonian program.
